content: history tells the phenomenal appearances of the will (determined by laws of nature) > man unintentionally promotes an end of nature unknown to him (in his own inclinations)

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: history tells the phenomenal appearances of the will (determined by laws of nature) > man unintentionally promotes an end of nature unknown to him (in his own inclinations)

content: philosophers must presume man’s own purpose (Absicht), so it is up to the philosopher to discover an end of nature in senseless march of human events > Kant will become the scientist of human history [?]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: philosophers must presume man’s own purpose (Absicht), so it is up to the philosopher to discover an end of nature in senseless march of human events > Kant will become the scientist of human history [?]

content: man transmits enlightenment to next generation: push genus of man to level appropriate to purpose of nature > otherwise natural faculties would be largely pointless & vain [is this an argument?]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: man transmits enlightenment to next generation: push genus of man to level appropriate to purpose of nature > otherwise natural faculties would be largely pointless & vain [is this an argument?]

content: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has given man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has given man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

content: it is as if Nature is more concerned with man’s rational self-esteem (vernünftige Selbstschätzung), than w/ his well-being: man alone should take credit for his enlightenment > nature planned the toil of earlier generations: antagonism is purposeful, it leads to law

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: it is as if Nature is more concerned with man’s rational self-esteem (vernünftige Selbstschätzung), than w/ his well-being: man alone should take credit for his enlightenment > nature planned the toil of earlier generations: antagonism is purposeful, it leads to law

content: man’s propensity to enter into society is also linked to a resistance (Widerstande) > man has a desire to associate (vergesellschaften) himself w/ other men and to isolate (vereinzelnen) himself: latter resistance, in society, can come in the form of vainglory and ambition [inclination as Hang or Neigung]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

content: transition, by way of continuous enlightenment, from a pathologically enforced co-ordination of society into a moral whole > raw natural faculty of moral discrimination becomes practical principles

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: transition, by way of continuous enlightenment, from a pathologically enforced co-ordination of society into a moral whole > raw natural faculty of moral discrimination becomes practical principles

content: man would just be an animal w/out the lust to rule [this leads to moral insight?]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: man would just be an animal w/out the lust to rule [this leads to moral insight?]

content: supreme task nature has set for mankind: freedom under external laws (Freiheit unter äußeren Gesetzen), a perfectly just civil constitution (eine vollkommen gerechte bürgerliche Verfassung) > the greatest want (Not) leads to laws [metaphor of trees]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: supreme task nature has set for mankind: freedom under external laws (Freiheit unter äußeren Gesetzen), a perfectly just civil constitution (eine vollkommen gerechte bürgerliche Verfassung) > the greatest want (Not) leads to laws [metaphor of trees]

content: man an animal who, if he lives amongst his kind, needs a master > this master breaks man’s will, compels him to obey general will (under which everyone is free) > [who is the master of the master?] highest master should be just in himself and yet a man, right conceptions, great experience, good will > a complete solution [master’s invention of perfect civil constitution?] is impossible [regulative idea?]

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

content: we do not know how things are arranged w/ inhabitants on other planets > only the species, not the individual (on earth) can achieve his/her destiny

content: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring about new relations among states and to form new bodies (break up the old)

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

linkedContent: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring about new relations among states and to form new bodies (break up the old)

content: a state, through laws, can maintain itself automatically [?] > [on a thought that does not see purpose in nature, that reads history as accidental] one presumes all these events will result in nothing, that the species is just preparing us for a hell of evils

source.title: Idea for a Universal History with Cosmopolitan Intent
source.author: KA

content: COSMOPOLITAN STATE > if States just want their own expansion, this will hinder expansion of citizens’ minds

content: general premise that the world is constituted as a system [presupposition] > even feeble traces (schwachen Spuren) of this state become very important > at least there is some maintenance if not progress

content: [Hegel-like] might this conviction in purpose only write a novel? [fiction in philosophy] > we are too short-sighted to perceive the secret mechanism of nature’s plan, a planless conglomeration of human activities could be used as a guide when presented as a SYSTEM > trace of this plan in every art, culture, law
